column1: 1@"What Age Do People Get Their First Periods?"@"Most girls get their first periods between the ages of 11 and 14
column2: but you might be younger or older than that when you get yours—there's no "right" age to get it. Ask your mother when she got her first period. It's a good indication of when yours might come."

column1: 2@"What Are the Signs That Your Period is Coming?"@"The signs are a little different for everyone
column3: you'll get really good at reading your body. Some things to look for
column12: and a breakout of a couple zits. You won't experience all of these symptoms before your period every month

column1: 3@"What Can You Do About the Pain?"@"When you've got your period
column2: sometimes the best thing you can do is take a bath
column4: and relax. To lessen the pain
column5: you can try over-the-counter pain relievers
column8: or placing a hot water bottle on your belly. You might also want to stay away from greasy or spicy foods."

column1: 4@"Can You Delay Your Period From Coming or Stop It Once It's Started?"@"There's no natural way to change the day of your period or make it end more quickly. There are some birth control pills out there that can make your period only come a couple of times a year
column2: but those aren't safe for everyone
column3: and they come with some side effects that you might think are worse than getting your period once a month. Talk to your doctor if you're thinking about trying birth control pills."

column1: 5@"What Does It Mean If You Have Irregular Periods?"@"Most women's cycles are around 28 days
column2: but different women might have different cycles and your own schedule might change from month to month due to stress
column4: or a change in your weight. The first two years after you get your first period can be especially irregular; you might even skip whole months. As long as you get your period eventually

column1: 6@"Can You Get Pregnant While On Your Period?"@"Yes—if you have unsafe vaginal sex
column2: you can get pregnant during any part of your menstrual cycle
column3: including when you're on your period. To make sure that doesn't happen
column4: you need to practice safe sex and use a condom every single time you have sex."
